overview:
Randy Ahn joined Vibe Media/Access Network in January 2012, immediately following the merger of Vibe, BlackBook, and Uptown Magazines under Ron Burkle and Earvin “Magic” Johnson’s Yucaipa Johnson Fund. As SVP, Business Development & Integrated Programs, Ahn is responsible for developing strategic integrated programs for the brands across all platform verticals including; mobile, online, social, video, print, events, and email marketing. He is also responsible for all strategic partnerships and secondary revenue opportunities.

Prior to joining Vibe Media/Access Network, Ahn was at July Systems, where he headed up strategic program initiatives for the US and international markets. His responsibilities included; defining product, service and program requirements as the industry continues to transform, as well as creating and identifying strategic partnerships for the company.

Ahn’s previous role was at CBS where he was responsible for the strategic growth of the mobile business for CBS Sports, CBS College Sports, and MaxPreps. During his time as Vice President, the business grew to include products across a wide variety of mobile categories which strengthen CBSâ€™s 3 platform strategy for growth.
